intro: Gongronema welwitschii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other members commonly referred to as nettles. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, typically greenish-white in color. Gongronema welwitschii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
